column4: why doesn't Ubuntu ship the latest Firefox? I just installed Ubuntu and I have 2.0.0.8 but 2.0.0.9 is out.... why is there a lag?
why don't they just ship the latest official Firefox
instead of doing whatever it is they do
for instance Glade 3 is broke, will there be a fix for it?
I'm holding out for the Ubuntu that evolves like Gentoo
I want a binary distro like Ubuntu that evolves not stagnates for 6 months
anyway just don't realize why Ubuntu doesn't ship the latest version of Firefox
I mean is it really too much to ask to have the latest Firefox? Sure I could download a binary
I'm sure theres a reason why.
If you dont have any support questions and just want to complain, you are free to leave at any time.
We don't need that kind of attitude here.
I'm not complaining
I don't have an attitude
I'd tell you, but our issue/package tracking system (Launchpad) is currently down for planned maintenance.
I see most people see my words as a complaint which tells me that I am not the only one to mention this
I dont know right now.  I can't access the information.  But I'm sure that theres a logical reason why.
If you want to look yourself in a bit, you can look at the firefox package's bug reports on bugs.ubuntu.com, but its scheduled to be down for right now.
Security updates almost always get through, I'm sure theres a logical reason why this didn't.
At this point the subeject is offtopic, please move to #ubuntu-offtopic :)
I am not going to continue this
okay :)
the point is I like Ubuntu, I just don't agree with the 6 month release cycle, I think it's really outdated
